snippet: Eliot Spitzer, who resigned as governor of New York in 2008 amid a prostitution scandal, has until Thursday to obtain the necessary signatures to get on the ballot.
abstract: Eliot Spitzer, who resigned as governor of New York amid prostitution scandal, is re-entering political life with run for New York City comptroller; move, which mirrors recent attempts by other disgraced politicians, is wager that voters are ready to look past his previous misconduct.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: Eliot Spitzer, who resigned as governor of New York in 2008 amid a prostitution scandal, has until Thursday to obtain the necessary signatures to get on the ballot.

headline.main: Spitzer Rejoins Politics, Asking for Forgiveness
headline.print_headline: Spitzer Rejoins Politics, Asking For Forgiveness
